scope

Class StringScope

  • java.lang.Object
    • scope.StringScope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scope<java.lang.String>

    public class StringScope
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scope<java.lang.String>
    An implementation of a Scope for Strings.
    Version:
    October 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String value)
        A String is within the scope if:
        • it is of the right length (within the scope of the length generator
        • all of its characters are in its alphabet (within the scope of the character generator
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Scope<java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true iff the String is within the this scope.

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Build a String from this scope.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Scope<java.lang.String>
        Returns:
        a String within this scope/

      • size

        public int size()
        Calculate the number of Strings in this scope. The number of Strings in the scope is the sum of a geometric series. If the alphabet contains c characters, then there is one string of length zero, c strings of length one, c2 strings of length 2, etc. So, if the maximum string length is n, we have 1+c+c2+...+cn which is cn+1⁄c-1.
        Specified by:
        size in interface Scope<java.lang.String>
        Returns:
        the number of Strings in this scope.
